titleStmt.title: Richard H. Collins to James F. Robinson
CWG7905

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
RICHARD H. COLLINS,
Attorney and Counselor at Law,
CINCINNATI, O.
Office, No. 68 West Third Street, between Walnut and Vine, opposite "Bank of the Ohio Valley."
☞Special attention given to the Collection of Claims in all the Western States, Kentucky and Tennessee. In sending Claims, don't fail to give the individual names of all FIRMS, whether owning the claims or liable in any way as payer.
Cincinnait, O., March 4, 1863.
To His Excellency, Gov. Robinson,
Frankfort, Ky.
Dear sir:

I desire the appointment as Commissioner of Deeds, &c., for Ky. at this point or in Ohio. My residence is in Covington, but my office is in Cincinnati. The Statues do not require my family residence to be in this city, to make the appointment proper.

I was, for many years, Editor of the "Maysville Eagle;" and refer you, respectfully, to Martin P. Marshall & Harrisoon Taylor, Esqs., of Mason, and to Jno. F. Fisk, Gen. Jno. W. Finnell, or Robert A. Athey, of Kenton, or Col. A. G. Hodges of Frankfort.

By directing a Commission to be made out & forwarded, you will oblige
Your Obdt. Servt
Richd H. Collins.

Ohio
Comr of Deeds
R. H. Collins
Cincinnati
Com Issd Mar. 7. 1863

R H Collins asks Comm of deeds
Cincinnati
